title: `rust_2018_idioms` and `cargo test` do not work nice together
body:
The generated test code contains an `extern crate` statement that is no longer idiomatic in the 2018 edition.

I tried this code:

```rust,file=lib.rs
#![feature(rust_2018_preview)]
#![deny(rust_2018_idioms)]

#[cfg(test)]
mod tests {
    #[test]
    fn it_works() {
        assert_eq!(2 + 2, 4);
    }
}
```
with this configuration
```toml,file=Cargo.toml
cargo-features = ["edition"]

[package]
name = "rust-bug"
version = "0.1.0"
authors = ["Peter Wischer <peddermaster2@users.noreply.github.com>"]
edition = "2018"

[dependencies]
```

I expected to see this happen: The code would compile and the tests get executed

Instead, this happened: The compiler failed with this message:
```
   Compiling rust-bug v0.1.0 (file:///C:/dev/gits/rust-bug)
error: `extern crate` is not idiomatic in the new edition                ] 2/3: rust-bug
  |
note: lint level defined here
 --> src\lib.rs:2:9
  |
2 | #![deny(rust_2018_idioms)]
  |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  = note: #[deny(unused_extern_crates)] implied by #[deny(rust_2018_idioms)]

error: aborting due to previous error

error: Could not compile `rust-bug`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```
